thread.title: New Surrey deal for all-rounder Zafar Ansari
thread.title_full: New Surrey deal for all-rounder Zafar Ansari

title: New Surrey deal for all-rounder Zafar Ansari
text:
New Surrey deal for all-rounder Zafar Ansari 05 Oct 2015 15:31:52 
comments 
Zafar Ansari has signed a new three-year contract to keep him at Surrey until 2018. 
The all-rounder, 23, has played for the club since the Under-9s and more recently earned selection for England's ODI team and Test squad, although injury ruled him out of the upcoming series against Pakistan. 
"I have been at the club a long time now but have signed my new contract because I feel that, at the moment, Surrey is a good side that is getting better," Ansari said. 
"I am now at the stage in my career where I want to be at a club that offers the best chance of winning trophies, both now and in the future. With that in mind, therefore, I was very happy to commit to this new deal." 
Surrey director of cricket Alec Stewart added: "Zafar has had another excellent season for Surrey in all formats with both the bat and the ball and fully deserved his England selections. 
"I have every confidence that he will be around the England side for many years to come and am delighted he has committed his future to Surrey." Related Sport News
